description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

**Freshman English for Non-English Majors**

Spring 2021

Instructor: Prof. Tsu-Chung Su (蘇子中)                     

Office: 英語系誠823           Tel: 77491777

Office Hours: Tuesday & Thursday 12-2 p.m. or by appointment

E-mail: [tcsu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:tcsu@ntnu.edu.tw)

**Course Description**

This course is designed to support students in their use of English language in academic context. Through intensive and extended reading of text materials, engagement in production activities, and practice at the Self-Learning Center, students are expected to acquire communication strategies for reading, listening, speaking, and writing, develop fluency and autonomy, and improve their critical thinking skills.

**Course Objectives**

This course aims to (1) develop students’ four skills in English; (2) improve their knowledge of vocabulary and grammar in English; (3) build their confidence in speaking English; (4) enhance their learning motivation; (5) foster their cultural knowledge and intercultural competence.

**Delivery of instruction**

1\. Lecture; Video-watching

2\. Group discussion & cooperation (Quality Talk);

3\. Student Mid-Term presentation: Five-Minute PowerPoint Presentation

**Required Textbooks**

Course Requirements and Evaluation

1. Attendance and Preparation (10%): Students are expected to attend the class well prepared, and to arrive to class on time. Tardiness and absences will affect your final grade. If you miss the class on more than three occasions, you will fail the course. (Official documentation is required for an absence.) 

2. Class Participation & Presentations (10%): Active participations in class activities and language practices will foster your real-time communication skills and critical thinking, which will lead to a greater improvement in your English language learning. Therefore, you are highly recommended to actively participate in classroom activities such as pair pair/group discussions. In addition, Students will make multiple oral presentations on assigned or chosen topics.

 3. After-Class Listening & Speaking Practice (5%): Weekly Listening Practice-- Students are required to practice their listening skills on a weekly basis by utilizing the audio and video resources provided at the Self-Access English Center (Located in 樸101). It is expected that students complete 3 times of listening practices before the mid-term and another 3 times afterwards, for a total number of 6 visits. 

4\. Mid-Term PowerPoint Presentation & Final Exam (50%) (25% each X 2)

5\. Lexile Test (25%)
